results.title: Cigarettes
results.material_description:
Digital video, bespoke artist box
edition 4 of 6 (+2 artist's proofs)
single channel 4:3 animation, colour, silent, continuous loop
media player, two SD cards, archival USB drive
results.brief_description:
Cigarettes is a single-channel projected animation, created as part of the Christian Marclay : Six Animations exhibition which debuted at 49 Geary Street, San Francisco, April 28 - June 25 2016. In this animation static photographs of cigarette butts have been edited together and played back in quick succession to give the illusion of motion.
Unlike traditional animation in which the setting is consistent and spatial continuity is maintained, in this work the background changes frantically. The flickering images recall flip-books, early cinema, and animation devices of the late nineteenth century, such as the zoetrope used by Eadweard Muybridge. Marclay’s animations set the discarded trails of rubbish in motion, giving the humble objects new life and transforming his chance encounters with trash into visual poetry. Taken from Fraenkel Gallery website https://fraenkelgallery.com/exhibitions/christian-marclay-six-new-animations

results.title: The Syrian Civil Defence
results.brief_description: Hospitals under siege, constant firefights, the Syrian Civil Defence sifting through bombed buildings. Millions of videos of the Syrian Civil War have been recorded and uploaded to YouTube and online platforms, but has all this footage made any difference?

results.title: Eliot Higgins, the founder of investigative journalism group Bellingcat, London
results.brief_description: Investigative journalism collective Bellingcat was the first to discover that Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 was downed by a missile fired from Ukraine. Its members use open-source intelligence to gather information from social media, public sources and geolocation to identify people, weapons and locations.

constellations_primary.name: The entire history of you
constellations_primary.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.title: Black Lives Matter demonstration in London
results.brief_description: BlackLivesMatter started appearing online after a white man was acquitted of killing unarmed black teenager Trayvon Martin in 2012. It has since evolved beyond a hashtag to become a worldwide movement used to unite activists and hold authorities to account.

results.title: Poster for Laura Poitras’ Citizenfour
results.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States, 2014
results.brief_description: Laura Poitras blurs the line between documentary and investigative journalism. Poitras was one of three journalists confided in by whistleblower Edward Snowden when he shared classified documents that detailed global government surveillance. Telling his story earned Poitras a Pulitzer, while Citizenfour won an Oscar.
